### Questions to answer

Answer the following in comments inside your application script:

1.  What was your level of comfort with the lesson/application?

2.  What areas of the lesson/application confused or still confuses you?

3.  What are some things you would like to know more about that is related to, but not covered in, this lesson?

### Upload changes to GitHub

1.  In ***Source Control*** tab, in ***Changes***: Click ***Stage All Changes***

    -   All changed files will now be under ***Staged Changes***

2.  Add a message "App{{< meta short >}} finished"

3.  Click ***Commit***

4.  The Commit button will become a Sync button, click ***Sync***

5.  Email {{< var instructor.email >}} with the message that application {{< meta short >}} is finished ***OR*** [Extension: Create an issue in GitHub]

![Upload changes to GitHub -- the red circle indicates how many files that changed (in this case: 1)](images/R-1-01_Upload.png){#fig-upload .fs}

## Extension: Create an issue in GitHub

1.  Go to your project folder (repository) on GitHub

2.  Click on ***Issues*** (top of page)

3.  Click on ***New Issue*** (green button – not pictured)

4.  Click on Setting wheel and add the instructor as an assignee (***belinskyc***)

5.  Put in ***title*** that application {{< meta short >}} is finished, add anything you want to the ***description***

6.  Click ***Create***

![Informing your instructor the application is finished](images/R-1-01_Inform.png){#fig-inform .fs}
